page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: The area contains the market town of Sudbury in the east and the fields and meadows of the Suffolk/Essex border to the west. The town is on the River Stour (the county boundry) and the village of Ballingdon on the Essex side is now a part of Sudbury. There are 2 small villages partly in- cluded-Bulmer in the southwest and Borley in the southeast-which rely on Sudbury for shops and entertainment as do many other villages nearby. Three main road links (to Ipswich, Bury St.Edmunds and Colchester),the river and the surviving (just) rail spur to Colchester confirm Sudbury's importance as a route centre. Local agriculture, now highly mechanised and efficient, together with development of light indutrial factory estates and a recent population increase have produced a thriving community.
